data.title: Hong Kong Protest Leaders Set Terms for Government Talks
data.meta_description: Hong Kong’s pro-democracy protest leaders have set conditions to resume talks with the government, potentially paving the way to end demonstrations that have now stretched into a fifth week.
data.text:
Hong Kong’s pro-democracy protest leaders have set conditions to resume talks with the government, potentially paving the way to end demonstrations that have now stretched into a fifth week.

The government should submit a report to China reflecting the protesters’ demand for free elections in the city in order for the talks to be “fruitful,” the Hong Kong Federation of Students, one of the leading groups behind the movement, said in an open letter yesterday. Failing that, protest leaders would like to meet Chinese Premier Li Keqiang , it said.
